author: R Krishnamoorthy
text:
Erode West is one among 17 constituencies in the State for implementation of voter-verified paper audit trail (VVPAT), a method for independent verification of votes cast as intended and a barrier to changing or destroying votes.

The district administration has received from the Election Commission of India 386 numbers of printer-like apparatus that would be linked to the Electronic Voting Machine.

Receipt

A receipt generated when a vote is cast shows the serial number, name and symbol of the candidate. The receipt gets deposited inside a container linked to the EVM and could be accessed by election officers in case necessity arises.

The prototype of VVPAT developed by Bharat Electronics Limited, Bangalore and Electronics Corporation of India Limited, Hyderabad was put to field trial twice in Thiruvananthapuram, Delhi, Jaisalmer, Cherrapunji and Leh during July 2011 and a year later. The Central Government amended the Conduct of Election Rules, 1961, enabling the ECI to use VVPAT with EVMs.

Data deleted

The district administration has, meanwhile, has deleted the data in the 2,850 EVMs and equal number of Control Units that were transported from Beed district of Maharashtra in five lorries last month, for conduct of elections in eight Assembly segments: Erode East, Erode West, Perundurai, Modakurichi, Bhavani, Gobichettipalayam, Anthiyur and Bhavani Sagar.

The electronic voting machines have been kept in safe custody at the Kamaraj Higher Secondary School in Corporation limits.
title: Erode West among 17 constituencies for VVPAT implementation
